intro: Licania polita f. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf licania, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves that are typically arranged alternately along the stems. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are often pink or white in color. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
